question_details.title: Will the Project 2025 Tracker spreadsheet mark the objective of eliminating the Low-Income Heat and Energy Assistance Program as complete on April 1, 2025?
question_details.description: At the time of this question, the objective was marked as "in progress." The 2025 Tracker is a project of the Keep_Track subreddit and is explained [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/Keep_Track/comments/1ii7tbr/project_2025_tracker_is_now_live/).
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Project 2025 objective to "eliminate the Low-Income Heat and Energy Assistance Program" is marked as complete according to [this spreadsheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1QGG6wNHna-1tt91yXNkOauAJJ7snobFjfEnmxlmzhl4/edit?gid=0#gid=0) when accessed by Metaculus on or after April 1, 2025.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Deadline Approaching for Electricity Bill Assistance in Mecklenburg County**
Residents of Mecklenburg County in North Carolina have until March 31 to apply for assistance with their electricity bills through the Low-Income Energy Assistance Program (LIEAP). Eligible low-income households can receive a one-time payment of $300, $400, or $500, depending on the service used, to help with heating costs. To be eligible, households must meet the following requirements: their income must be below the poverty threshold, which is $15,650 for a single person, $21,150 for two people, and $26,650 for three people, with an additional $5,550 for each additional household member. Devon Kilpatrick, manager of the energy program, said, 'Access to affordable heating is essential for the well-being of people and families, especially during the winter months.' He also stated that 'this program provides critical financial support to help households manage heating costs and maintain a safe and comfortable home environment.' 
Original language: es
Publish date: March 14, 2025 06:44 PM
Source:[La Nacion](https://www.lanacion.com.ar/estados-unidos/carolina-del-norte/carolina-del-norte-se-acerca-la-fecha-limite-para-pedir-ayuda-con-el-pago-de-la-tarifa-electrica-en-nid14032025/)

**Ministry of Finance Issues Clean Energy Development Special Fund Management Measures**
The Ministry of Finance has officially issued the 'Clean Energy Development Special Fund Management Measures' on March 12, 2025, to promote the transition to clean and low-carbon energy. The measures specify that central government funds will be allocated to support the development of renewable energy, clean fossil fuels, and the utilization of fossil fuels. The fund will be implemented from 2025 to 2029. According to the measures, the fund will focus on five key areas: the demonstration and promotion of clean energy key technologies, the development and utilization of clean energy, the construction of public platforms, comprehensive application demonstrations, and other tasks assigned by the Party Central Committee. The funding will be allocated through competitive distribution, award-for-performance, and actual settlement, with a differentiated incentive policy for unconventional natural gas such as coalbed methane, shale gas, and tight gas. Specifically, projects that increase production by more than last year will be rewarded at a tiered rate, while those that decrease production will have their funding reduced. Additionally, projects that increase production during the heating season will receive an extra 'winter increase bonus' policy. The special fund will be used exclusively for its designated purpose and will be managed in two categories: central projects and local projects. Central enterprises with 100% state ownership can directly apply for funding, while local projects will be coordinated by provincial finance departments. The funding will be disbursed in a pre-advance and post-settlement model, requiring provinces and central enterprises to optimize funding distribution based on production efficiency and ensure that funds are used for technology upgrades, safety production, and emission reduction and efficiency improvements. This policy revision has strengthened support for coalbed gas development, aiming to promote the utilization of coal mine gas through economic incentives while achieving dual goals of energy production and environmental protection.
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 14, 2025 05:56 AM
Source:[经济观察报](http://www.eeo.com.cn/2025/0314/716399.shtml)

**Swiss Federal Council Partially Implements Environmental Protection Act Modification**
The Swiss Federal Council has partially implemented the modification of the Environmental Protection Act (LPAmb) and abolished two ordinances, effective April 1, 2025. The goal is to accelerate the cleanup of contaminated sites. Other changes to the LPAmb concern tax incentives, environmental crime prosecution, and information and documentation systems. According to the new regulations, the fund for contaminated sites will support investigations and cleanups until 2032 and 2045, respectively. The fund will also support the cleanup of private playgrounds and gardens contaminated by hazardous substances. The Confederation will participate financially in the investigation and cleanup of sites near waste incineration plants or contaminated fire training centers. Environmental crime prosecution has been strengthened to combat the billion-dollar global environmental crime market. Simplifying information exchange between law enforcement and environmental authorities will make environmental crime prosecution more efficient. New information and documentation systems will simplify and accelerate data exchange between federal and cantonal authorities, applicants, and those subject to declaration obligations. The ordinances on tax incentives for 'extra-light' heating oil, gasoline, and diesel have been abolished, as they are obsolete due to stricter regulations in the anti-pollution ordinance. The provisions on noise protection will enter into force in the spring of 2026, after the anti-noise pollution ordinance is revised. All other changes to the LPAmb and the abolition of the two ordinances will take effect on April 1, 2025.
Original language: it
Publish date: March 14, 2025 12:00 AM
Source:[The Swiss Federal Gouvernment](https://www.admin.ch/gov/it/pagina-iniziale/documentazione/comunicati-stampa.msg-id-104482.html)

**Government Eliminates 11 Programs from Secretariat of Childhood**
The government has eliminated 11 programs from the Secretariat of Childhood, as formalized through resolutions published in the Official Gazette on March 13, 2025. According to the resolutions, the elimination of these programs aims to achieve 'good management and efficient administration of resources.' The decision responds to the need to reorganize and unify regulations that involved duplication of functions and inefficient use of public resources. The goal is to avoid the overlap of initiatives and ensure a more efficient and transparent administration. However, the dissolution of these programs has raised concerns among various sectors, as many of them were focused on protecting and promoting the rights of children, adolescents, and vulnerable populations. Social organizations and child experts have expressed their worry about the potential negative impact of these measures on the affected population. The elimination of these programs reflects a shift in the government's social and cultural policies, centered on optimizing resources and restructuring initiatives.
Original language: es
Publish date: March 13, 2025 07:08 PM
Source:[El Litoral](https://www.ellitoral.com/politica/gobierno-elimino-11programas-secretaria-ninez_0_MVASyRF1mI.html)

**MOЭК to Eliminate 30 Abandoned Thermal Network Sections in Moscow**
Moscow United Energy Company (MOЭК) plans to eliminate 30 abandoned sections of thermal networks in Moscow's above-ground laying, known as bypasses, by 2025. The project is part of a three-year program (2024-2026) implemented jointly with the Moscow Department of Housing and Utilities. 'During the work, heat supply to consumers will be switched to newly built sections of thermal networks in underground execution. In total, within the framework of the program, it is planned to inspect objects, develop and agree on design and estimate documentation, and perform work on reorganization of abandoned bypasses at more than 80 addresses,' the press service said. Most of the abandoned bypasses were not removed underground on time by organizations that previously connected their construction objects to heat supply. As a rule, these companies were liquidated and did not fulfill their obligations to the city for various reasons. MOЭК (part of 'Gazprom Energy Holding') is the unified heat supplier of Moscow, ensuring centralized heating and hot water supply to the capital.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 13, 2025 07:45 AM
Source:[Недвижимость РИА Новости](https://realty.ria.ru/20250313/moek-2004692522.html)

**Moscow to Eliminate Over 30 Abandoned Bypasses in 2025**
Moscow's Complex of Urban Economy will eliminate over 30 abandoned bypasses in 2025, according to Deputy Mayor Petr Biryukov. The city has been working on a program to remove these bypasses since 2014, and over 200 have already been demolished. Biryukov explained that bypasses are temporary pipelines for heat and water supply, usually built for repairs or construction. However, some companies that built them failed to remove them in time, leaving them abandoned. 'These temporary structures have not been removed in a timely manner by the companies that built them, and these companies have been liquidated without fulfilling their obligations,' Biryukov said. The Moscow Energy Company will conduct the demolition in several stages, starting with project development, followed by the installation of new permanent pipelines during the off-peak season, and finally, the removal of the old bypasses. Biryukov emphasized that only abandoned bypasses will be removed, while construction bypasses will continue to be used during building or repair projects.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 13, 2025 06:02 AM
Source:[Вечерняя Москва](https://vm.ru/news/1213011-v-2025-godu-v-moskve-likvidiruyut-bolee-30-uchastkov-beshoznyh-bajpasov)

**Jeju City Supports Low-Income Households with Energy Efficiency Improvement Project**
The Jeju City government is recruiting applicants for its energy efficiency improvement project, which aims to support low-income households with energy-efficient air conditioning and heating systems. The project is divided into two categories: the air conditioning efficiency improvement project, which will replace air conditioners for energy-vulnerable households, and the heating efficiency improvement project, which will provide insulation, windows, and old boiler replacements. The deadline for applying for the air conditioning project is April 18, while the heating project will be open until the target number of households is reached. A total of 174 households will be supported with air conditioning and 182 households with heating, with a budget of 720,000 KRW and 2,430,000 KRW respectively. However, households receiving housing benefits, public housing residents, and those who have received the project benefits in the past and have not yet passed the specified period will be excluded. The city government has supported 213 households (114 air conditioning and 99 heating) last year to improve their energy usage environment. According to Go Gwang-su, the head of the Jeju City's Energy and Industry Department, 'I hope this project will help improve the living environment of energy-vulnerable households.' He added, 'We will continue to work towards improving energy welfare.'
Original language: ko
Publish date: March 13, 2025 02:34 AM
Source:[뉴시스 (NEWSIS)](https://www.newsis.com/view/NISX20250313_0003097373)

**Ministry of Industry, Trade and Energy Selects 5 New R&D Projects for Coexistence Innovation Program**
The Ministry of Industry, Trade and Energy announced that it has selected 5 new research and development (R&D) projects for the 'Coexistence Innovation' program, which aims to combine the business capabilities of medium-sized enterprises and the innovation capabilities of small and medium-sized enterprises. A total of 71 consortia applied for the program, resulting in a 14:1 competition ratio. The program will provide R&D funding of around 3.9 billion won per year for 3 years to consortia consisting of medium-sized enterprises and 2 or more small and medium-sized enterprises. The evaluation process will be completed through a preliminary evaluation in March and a comprehensive evaluation in April, and the selected consortia will sign a cooperation agreement in April and begin implementing the projects. According to an official from the Ministry, 'We will manage the evaluation process fairly to select the most suitable projects for the business objectives, and we will also make efforts to expand the related budget in the future.'
Original language: ko
Publish date: March 13, 2025 02:06 AM
Source:[뉴시스 (NEWSIS)](https://www.newsis.com/view/NISX20250313_0003096757)

**Government Spokesperson: Fuel Subsidies to End by 2025, Solar and Butane Gas to Remain Subsidized**
The government's spokesperson, Mohammed Al-Hamssani, stated that the country is continuing to implement the economic reform program, citing the need to rationalize subsidies and direct them to those who deserve them, and to gradually increase fuel prices to reach the equilibrium price. He added that 'the state will continue to support some petroleum products to maintain a reasonable and balanced price for solar energy', as it is a basic commodity that affects many services. In response to a question from journalist Ahmed Mousa, Al-Hamssani said, 'Yes, the support for fuel will end by the end of 2025, and then the price will be determined by the global market. However, even after the support for fuel ends, there will still be support for solar and butane gas, as they have a direct impact on the prices of goods and low-income citizens. This support will be covered by a subsidy on other petroleum products.' Al-Hamssani emphasized that the ultimate goal is to achieve a balance between the real cost of fuel and its selling price, stating, 'Prices will be adjusted, but solar energy will still be subsidized, as it cannot be sold at its real price; it would affect low-income citizens and the prices of goods.' 
Original language: ar
Publish date: March 12, 2025 10:37 PM
Source:[جريدة الشروق](https://www.shorouknews.com/news/view.aspx?cdate=13032025&id=6f622c52-7bc9-4513-8263-f59fc79d86b3)

**Government Spokesperson Announces Complete Stop of Support for Petroleum Derivatives by 2025**
The government spokesperson, Mohamed Al-Hamssani, announced that the support for petroleum derivatives will be completely stopped by the end of 2025. However, he stated that there will still be support for butane gas and solar energy, as they affect the prices of goods and therefore low-income households. Al-Hamssani emphasized that the support for solar and butane gas will be covered by other petroleum materials, and that the solar energy cannot be sold at its real price as it would affect the citizens. He also mentioned that there is consideration for low-income households and that is why the support for solar energy will continue.
Original language: ar
Publish date: March 12, 2025 09:43 PM
Source:[مصراوي.كوم](https://www.masrawy.com/news/news_egypt/details/2025/3/12/2743180/%D9%85%D8%AA%D8%AD%D8%AF%D8%AB-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AD%D9%83%D9%88%D9%85%D8%A9-%D9%88%D9%82%D9%81-%D8%AF%D8%B9%D9%85-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%B4%D8%AA%D9%82%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A8%D8%AA%D8%B1%D9%88%D9%84%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D8%A8%D8%B4%D9%83%D9%84-%D9%83%D8%A7%D9%85%D9%84-%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%D9%8A%D8%A9-2025)

**Government to Support Low-Income Households with High-Efficiency Air Conditioners and Boilers**
The Ministry of Industry, Trade and Resources announced that it will start accepting applications for the 'Low-Income Energy Efficiency Project' on March 5, 2025. The project aims to support 54,000 low-income households and 750 social welfare facilities by replacing high-efficiency boilers and air conditioners, and other energy-saving measures. The project will provide support for insulation and floor work, window replacement, and high-efficiency boiler support for heating support, and high-efficiency air conditioner support for cooling support. The government will invest 107.6 billion won in this project this year, with a goal of supporting 36,000 households and 250 facilities for heating support, and 18,000 households and 500 facilities for cooling support. The application method is to support the construction and materials within the application unit price, and there is no additional self-contribution. The cooling support project will be supported until summer, and the application period will be until April 18. The heating support project will be accepted until the budget is exhausted. This year, the project will be applied in a way that combines the application for cooling support and heating support during the application period for cooling support. For more information, please contact the Low-Income Energy Efficiency Improvement Project Call Center (☏1670-7653).
Original language: ko
Publish date: March 03, 2025 03:44 AM
Source:[메트로신문](https://metroseoul.co.kr/article/20250303500100)

**Low-Income Energy Efficiency Improvement Project to Start on March 5**
The Ministry of Industry and Technology will start the low-income energy efficiency improvement project on March 5, which aims to improve the energy efficiency of buildings and provide high-efficiency heating and cooling equipment to vulnerable households and social welfare facilities. The project will provide 110 billion won in funding, with 3,600 households and 250 facilities to be supported for heating, and 18,000 households and 500 facilities for cooling. The project will be applied through the local administrative welfare center, and the application period for heating support is until the budget is exhausted, while the application period for cooling support is until April 18. This year, the project will focus on increasing synergy between the heating and cooling support projects and improving the convenience of applicants. According to the Ministry of Industry and Technology, the project supported 36,977 households for heating and 18,034 households for cooling last year, with a 22.6% energy saving effect for households that received heating support.
Original language: ko
Publish date: March 03, 2025 02:01 AM
Source:[뉴시스 (NEWSIS)](https://www.newsis.com/view/NISX20250301_0003083546)

**Columbia Gas customers struggling to pay bill may qualify for LIHEAP crisis grants**
Columbia Gas of Virginia is reminding customers that the deadline to apply for crisis grants through the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) is approaching. The program provides aid for heating fuel utility bills, security deposits, and equipment-related assistance. According to Stephanie Benson, Communications Manager for Columbia Gas of Virginia, 'We've all had to use our heat a little bit more this year, maybe a lot more, and we recognize that our customers may need assistance with paying their utility bills, because we never want them to feel like they have to choose between feeding their families or keeping them warm.' The maximum benefit for a utility bill payment is $450, and households can receive one crisis grant per heating season and one crisis grant for a security deposit in their lifetime. Eligible customers can apply online, by phone, or in person, and the income eligibility threshold for the 2024-2025 program is 150% of the federal poverty guidelines, which means individuals earning up to $22,590 annually and families of four earning up to $46,800 may qualify for assistance.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 26, 2025 07:15 PM
Source:[https://www.wdbj7.com](https://www.wdbj7.com/2025/02/26/columbia-gas-customers-struggling-pay-bill-may-qualify-liheap-crisis-grants/)

**MaPrimeRenov 2025: Budget Reduced to 2.1 Billion Euros**
The 2025 budget, adopted on February 6, confirms the reduction in credits allocated to MaPrimeRenov. The program, which provides aid for energy-efficient home renovations, will decrease from 3.1 billion euros to 2.1 billion euros. The eligible works, such as thermal insulation, heating, and ventilation, remain the same. However, the budget reduction will lead to a decrease in certain subsidies, like the wood-burning heating systems forfait, which will decrease by an average of 30%. The aid thresholds, or 'taux d'écrêtement', will also be adjusted to better match the needs of households based on their income. These new modalities will apply to all applications submitted since January 1, 2025, according to the Minister. 'The goal is to provide more targeted support to households in need,' said the Minister.
Original language: fr
Publish date: February 17, 2025 06:22 PM
Source:[Ladepeche.fr](https://www.ladepeche.fr/2025/02/17/21-millairds-deuros-pour-maprimerenoven-2025-12508839.php)

**Energy Check 2025: A 20% Reduction in Aid Possible, When Will It Be Paid?**
The energy check, a government aid for low-income households to help pay their energy bills, may see a 20% reduction in 2025. The budget for the program could be cut from 900 million euros to 720 million euros, which would result in a decrease of 10 to 55 euros in the check amount. The reduction was announced by Minister Amélie de Montchalin in mid-January, citing the decrease in electricity prices starting in February. However, this decrease will not affect the entire population (80%), and gas prices will actually increase for indexed offers starting in February. The energy check amount has not been increased since its creation, despite rising energy prices. The reduction is not yet confirmed and will depend on the decision of parliamentarians during the 2025 budget vote in early February. The energy check will still be renewed in 2025, with the exact payment schedule to be determined, but it will likely be distributed in the spring, between early April and mid-May.
Original language: fr
Publish date: January 29, 2025 10:18 AM
Source:[L'internaute](https://www.linternaute.com/argent/guide-de-vos-finances/1427598-cheque-energie-2025-une-baisse-de-l-aide-de-20-se-profile-quand-sera-t-elle-versee/)

**Changes to the French Energy Check Program for 2025**
The French government is considering changes to the energy check (chèque-énergie) program for 2025. The program, which provides financial assistance to low-income households with energy expenses, may see changes in the amount of aid and eligibility conditions. The government has proposed maintaining automatic attribution of the energy check to ensure that eligible households receive the aid without additional paperwork. However, the program's budget may be reduced by 180 million euros, which could affect the amount distributed to each of the 5.6 million eligible households. The Senate has validated an amendment to simplify the access to the energy check and ensure that the aid reaches the most vulnerable households more efficiently.
Original language: fr
Publish date: January 28, 2025 06:30 PM
Source:[lenergeek.com](https://lenergeek.com/2025/01/28/cheque-energie-quels-changements-2025/)

**Help Paying The Heating Bills**
Pennsylvanians struggling to pay their heating bills can apply for the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) until April 4, 2025. The program provides a one-time cash grant of $200 to $1,000, depending on household size, income, and fuel type, which will be sent directly to the utility provider or fuel company to be credited on the bill. Additionally, individuals experiencing a heat-related emergency may be eligible for a crisis grant. Both renters and homeowners are eligible, and no prior public assistance program or unpaid heating bills are required to qualify. Applications can be submitted online or by calling the LIHEAP Hotline at 1-866-857-7095, Monday through Friday.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 27, 2025 12:00 AM
Source:[wdac.com](https://wdac.com/help-paying-the-heating-bills/)

**Eligible low-income households could get help with winter heating bills**
The Low Income Energy Assistance Program (LIEAP) is reminding Wyoming residents that it offers assistance to certain low-income households in need of help with heating bills and home weatherization. According to LIEAP, the organization can help with heating emergencies like broken furnaces, empty fuel tanks, and utility issues. LIEAP can assist in the following ways: repairing or replacing broken heating systems, refilling or delivering propane, resolving utility issues, and covering propane tank setup and fuel costs. Applications indicating a crisis, such as lost heat or impending disconnection, are expedited to ensure timely support. LIEAP's crisis and prevention assistance is available until April 15, 2025, and may extend further if Wyoming faces severe weather conditions or rising fuel costs. 'Applications that indicate a crisis — such as lost heat, insufficient fuel, or impending disconnection — are expedited, ensuring that households receive timely support,' the release states. 'Specific response times may vary based on the situation.'
Original language: en
Publish date: January 25, 2025 03:17 AM
Source:[county17.com](https://county17.com/2025/01/24/eligible-low-income-households-could-get-help-with-winter-heating-bills/)

**Evergy to assist customers Wednesday for the Low Income Energy Assistance Program**
Evergy Kansas customers can apply for the 2025 Low Income Energy Assistance Program (LIEAP) on Wednesday, January 22, from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. at the Topeka & Shawnee County Public Library. Evergy specialists will assist customers with applications. To qualify, households must have an adult responsible for heating costs and a combined gross income not exceeding 150% of the federal poverty level. Customers should bring proof of income and current utility bills. The application period is open until March 31.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 21, 2025 06:08 PM
Source:[wibw.com](https://www.wibw.com/2025/01/21/evergy-assist-customers-wednesday-low-income-energy-assistance-program/)

**Colorado reports 8% increase in people receiving help to pay heating, energy bills**
The Low Income Energy Assistance Program (LEAP) in Colorado has seen a surge in applications for assistance, with 90,000 people applying since November, a 5% increase from this time last year. Of those, 60,000 Coloradans have already received LEAP benefits, an 8% increase from last year. Program coordinator Vanessa Pena said, 'The need is out there,' citing recent data showing 14% of Coloradans have reported being unable to pay their home energy bills. LEAP's benefits range from $200 to $1,000 and applications are open through April 30, 2025. Pena encouraged people to seek help when needed, saying, 'We are always here to help. I would always encourage people to seek help when needed. The benefits are out here for a reason.'
Original language: en
Publish date: January 21, 2025 02:28 PM
Source:[CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/colorado/news/colorado-reports-8-increase-people-receiving-help-pay-heating-energy-bills/)

**Need Help With Energy Bills During What Feels Like Never-Ending Snowfall In Louisville?**
The Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) Winter Crisis is now open for enrollment in Kentucky, offering financial assistance for home heating costs. Households can apply through the Kentucky Community Action Network until March 31 or until allocated funds are depleted. The program provides payments directly to energy vendors and does not affect eligibility if prior assistance was received. To apply, households must meet income guidelines up to 150% of the Federal Poverty Level and provide proof of income, Social Security numbers, and a current heating bill. Additionally, households can apply for the Emergency Wastewater Rate Assistance Program (EWRAP) during a single appointment. 'Households must meet income guidelines up to 150% of the Federal Poverty Level,' according to the program. 'Applicants must be responsible for home heating costs or contribute to heating costs as part of rent.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: January 13, 2025 02:15 PM
Source:[leoweekly.com](https://www.leoweekly.com/news/need-help-with-energy-bills-during-what-feels-like-never-ending-snowfall-in-louisville-17314921)

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: To estimate the probability that the objective to eliminate the Low-Income Heat and Energy Assistance Program is marked as complete by April 1, 2025, I consider the historical success rates of similar objectives being completed by such organizations or groups. Historically, grassroots and community-driven projects that aim to track and influence governmental policies or programs often have varied success rates. Many may diligently track changes, but actual policy changes depend on many factors, including political will, current administration actions, and public opinion. A ballpark estimate for such objectives being achieved by a self-organized group could initially be around 30%.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Current U.S. Political Climate
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The political climate in the U.S., particularly with respect to changes in social welfare programs, can directly influence the probability of the elimination of such programs. As of 2025, if there is a government administration that is opposed to social welfare spending, the probability of the objective being marked as complete might increase. Suppose the political leadership leans towards reducing social welfare spending, which has been a trend with certain administrations trying to cut such programs. This increases the probability by +15%.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Legal Challenges
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Any attempt to eliminate a program like the Low-Income Heat and Energy Assistance Program is likely to face legal challenges. Such challenges can come from state governments, advocacy groups, or other stakeholders, potentially blocking or delaying such measures. These legal battles can reduce the likelihood of marking the objective as complete, thus decreasing the probability by -10%.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Public Opinion and Advocacy
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Public opinion can play a significant role in policy decisions. If there is strong public support for maintaining the Low-Income Heat and Energy Assistance Program, it can pressure legislators to maintain it, making it less likely that its elimination will be marked as complete. Advocacy groups could mobilize public opinion to protect the program. This can decrease the probability by -5%.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Technological and Operational Efficiency
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The efficiency with which the Project 2025 Tracker can organize, present, and influence policy outcomes also affects the probability. If the tracker is known for strong organization and factual reporting, it might influence decision-makers effectively, which could increase the probability by +5%.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: The news provides multiple instances where financial assistance programs similar to LIEAP are still active and receiving support. This indicates ongoing support for such programs and a lack of governmental urgency to eliminate them.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: There are no direct news articles suggesting the objective of eliminating the Low-Income Heat and Energy Assistance Program is imminently likely to be achieved. Instead, there are efforts to subsidize energy costs and enhance efficiency for low-income households, suggesting that there is a functioning infrastructure aimed at supporting rather than eliminating such programs.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: To estimate the initial probability of the Project 2025 Tracker marking the objective of eliminating the Low-Income Heat and Energy Assistance Program as complete by April 1, 2025, I will start by considering historical success rates of politically driven objectives that involve altering or eliminating social assistance programs. Historically, such objectives face significant pushback from stakeholders, including the public, advocacy groups, and political opponents. Let's assume that in prior cases with similar contexts, roughly 30% of such objectives are marked as 'complete' within a specified timeframe when initially indicated as 'in progress'. This is a rough estimate informed by historical legislative and policy change efforts prevalent in democratic environments.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Technical Monitoring and Reporting Efficiency
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: From a cybersecurity and information monitoring perspective, the capability of efficiently and reliably tracking changes in the Project 2025 Tracker is important. A high level of digital monitoring and reporting accuracy might allow for swift and transparent updates to the tracker. However, this factor does not inherently change the probability of the objective being completed, as it pertains more to the reporting of completion rather than influencing the completion itself.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Digital Advocacy and Public Pressure
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The presence of digital platforms greatly amplifies public opinion and can lead to increased pressure on projects like the 2025 Tracker. This pressure could influence decision-makers to either slow down or abandon their efforts to eliminate the assistance program. Given the already documented efforts to track and publicize such issues, a dedicated subreddit indicates an engaged community. analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: There are instances of government programs being eliminated, such as the 11 programs from the Secretariat of Childhood, which highlights a trend towards the elimination of social support initiatives for resource management purposes.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: To estimate the probability that the Project 2025 Tracker will mark the objective of eliminating the Low-Income Heat and Energy Assistance Program as complete by April 1, 2025, we consider past occurrences of similar policy eliminations. Historically, government assistance programs are not commonly eliminated swiftly due to bureaucratic processes, public opposition, or legislative hurdles. Based on this, we might estimate a low base rate, but given that the project is marked 'in progress,' it suggests progress. Assessing similar situations where programs were under review 'in progress' but not eliminated, a base rate of 30% for completion seems appropriate.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Political Climate and Policy Support
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: If the current political environment is favoring cutbacks on government spending, particularly on social programs, this might increase the likelihood of the objective being completed.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Community and Public Reaction
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Substantial public opposition or advocacy could slow down or halt the elimination process due to potential backlash that political leaders want to avoid.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Project Tracking and Accountability
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Given that this initiative is being actively tracked and transparently documented by a public platform, there is increased accountability which may increase the likelihood of objective completion to reflect progress.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Reports on efforts around the restructuring or elimination of multiple programs reflect a broader trend towards governmental efficiency and resource allocation, aligning with Project 2025's objective to eliminate certain programs.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: Numerous reports highlighting ongoing support and expansion of energy assistance programs, such as LIEAP and LIHEAP, indicate a strong ongoing demand and policy environment favoring energy assistance to low-income households.

summary: After analyzing the initial probabilities and updates based on new information, the experts have revised their forecasts regarding the likelihood of the Project 2025 Tracker marking the objective of eliminating the Low-Income Heat and Energy Assistance Program as complete by April 1, 2025. The probabilities were generally low across experts, with initial estimates ranging from 0% to 50%. Following the second phase updates, which included news reinforcing the ongoing support for similar energy assistance programs and challenges to the elimination of welfare programs, most experts revised their probabilities downward or maintained a low estimate. The final probabilities ranged from 0% to 40%, with a consensus suggesting a low likelihood of the objective being completed by the deadline. This reflects the challenges posed by public support for the program, bureaucratic and legislative hurdles, and the ongoing demand for energy assistance.
